sections.purpose: To accurately count microbial colonies on agar plates.
sections.scope: Applicable to quantitative microbiology and quality control.
procedure: Switch ON the colony counter light source.
Place the Petri dish on the glass platform.
Adjust the magnifying glass to a comfortable viewing position.
Use the electronic pen or probe to touch each colony.
Ensure the digital counter increments with each touch.
Observe the marked colonies to avoid double counting or misses.
Record the final count displayed on the digital screen.
Reset the counter to zero for the next plate.
Clean the platform with a soft, dry cloth after use.
precautions: Do not apply excessive pressure with the counting pen.
Ensure the light source is adequate and not flickering.
Handle the magnifying glass carefully to avoid scratches.
Keep the platform clear of ink marks or scratches.
Check the sensitivity of the pressure sensor regularly.
